Comment: The Caro-Kann, a solid defense. But even this line can go sour quickly if mishandled.

...White can do this, driving the Knight.
Compounding the mistake. 4... N-N1 was the best retreat.
Now White sets a nasty pitfall. The correct play is 5... N-B3 6 PxP ch KxP, after which Black could fight on for a while.
Leaving White the choice of two mates. The plebeian way is 7 BxP ch PxB 8 QxP mate. Damant chooses the more elegant method.
